image.altText: A fish with a flat head, long tail, brown stripes across its back and red rash, on the beach

props.synopsis: An algal bloom killing marine life in South Australia is persisting despite winter conditions. So what do we know about the bloom, and — perhaps more importantly — what don't we know?

title.children: What we know about the ecological disaster washing up on SA's coast

image.altText: A St Kilda player reaches his arms up to take hold of the ball as a pack of Saints and Hawks players contest.

props.synopsis: St Kilda and Hawthorn are locked in a tense clash at Docklands while Port Adelaide attempts to reel in Brisbane at the Gabba. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: 'Flying Viking' soars as Saints tackle Hawks, Port cops Lions onslaught

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sam Powell-Pepper has done his knee

image.altText: French bulldog in a blue sweater held by a woman, standing near steps and open outdoor spaces under clear skies

props.synopsis: A cold start to winter encourages people to put clothes on their dogs, but a vet has noticed a spate of wounds related to ill-fitting straps, prompting a warning to be careful what you buy.

title.children: Warning as dogs suffer 'horrific' injuries from jackets and jumpers

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: There are fears for around 50 jobs at the regional SA site as the company looks to "simplify" operations.

title.children: Regional SA jobs at risk as Santos reviews Port Bonython site

image.altText: A hand holds a remote pointed towards a large TV.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week its free-to-air channels were replaced with red screens when Seven West Media and WIN TV failed to agree on how much Seven would pay WIN to broadcast its programming.

title.children: Channel 7 back on air in regional SA, NSW after securing new WIN deal

image.altText: Woman with respiratory illness, blowing her nose into handkerchief.

props.synopsis: Reported flu cases across South Australia have spiked 70 per cent this year, with more than 1,000 cases in the last week alone. It has coincided with another rise in ambulance ramping, which soared in June to its second-highest level on record.

title.children: 'Alarming' spike in SA flu cases as ambulance ramping soars again

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

title.children: Killer jailed for 32 years over 'calculated, ruthless' murder

image.altText: A design proposal for the former Glenside hospital site.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has approved a developer's controversial bid to build apartments of up to 20 storeys in Adelaide's inner-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Rezoning approved for 20-storey apartments outside Adelaide CBD

image.altText: A white sign with green and black text and a basic map of Orana's properties. A plant is blurred in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A magistrate is scathing of the 38-year-old woman's use of clients' bank cards at a residential care facility, disputing claims that she was in a "complete drug psychosis" at the time of offending.

title.children: Disability worker's theft from clients 'a betrayal without decency'

image.altText: A CCTV still shows perpetrator walking and holding what police allege is a knife.

props.synopsis: The father, mother and brother of a woman who was the victim of an "honour" stabbing in Adelaide's north have had their sentences reduced.

title.children: Sentences reduced for family members convicted over 'honour' stabbing

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Port Lincoln's mayor says the grisly nature of the alleged murder of one of the town's long-time residents has been acutely felt in the community.

title.children: Coastal town reels after man allegedly killed by reality TV contestant

image.altText: A man with a beard wearing a check shirt, standing in front of a sign that says Golden North Ice Cream

props.synopsis: Locals say Golden North and the SA town of Laura are synonymous with each other, but the ice cream manufacturer is set to close its local factory.

title.children: SA town shocked at Golden North ice cream's exit

image.altText: A man wearing a police uniform.

props.synopsis: A newspaper article published this week reported a "high-ranking" SA police officer had accidentally fired their gun while attending a house in suburban Adelaide during the 1990s. Here's how the commissioner responded.

title.children: SA's police chief has opened up about a 1991 firearm incident — here's what was said

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands while sitting down and looking at each other in the face.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has discussed air defences with his US counterpart, agreeing to work on increasing Kyiv's capability to "defend the sky" as Russian attacks escalate.

title.children: Trump and Zelenskyy discuss US weapons for Ukrainian defence

image.altText: A close up of Albanese with an Australian map behind him

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's speech comes at a delicate moment in Australia's key strategic relationship, with the federal government grappling with an unpredictable White House.

title.children: Albanese to champion 'Australian independence' within US alliance

image.altText: A wombat.

props.synopsis: Dianna Bisset finds a dead wombat on the side of the road, with a small bullet mark just behind its ear. In town, there's no mystery as to why this protected species is in the crosshairs.

title.children: Someone in NSW's tablelands is shooting perfectly healthy wombats. Locals know why

image.altText: Huge clouds of dark gray smoke billow into the air as the ruined Gaza skyline is visible in the background.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has responded in "a positive spirit" to a US-brokered Gaza ceasefire proposal and is prepared to enter talks about implementing the deal.

title.children: Hamas responds in 'positive spirit' to Gaza ceasefire proposal

image.altText: Dancers in red shirts and black skirts move under a purple dusk sky while a crowd watches on.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Tibetans gathered in the Indian Himalayas in a hill town where the Dalai Lama has lived in exile for more than six decades to celebrate his 90th birthday.

title.children: Deep in the Himalayas, thousands are celebrating a 'momentous day'

image.altText: emergency services at a scene in bidwill where police officers were allegedly assaulted following a concern for welfare report

props.synopsis: Two female officers were allegedly assaulted following reports of a mental health incident in Bidwill on Friday evening. A third male officer was allegedly bitten on the arm.

title.children: Three police officers allegedly assaulted by 19yo in 'sickening attack'

image.altText: a man searches a suitcase

props.synopsis: Police allege two 18-year-olds tried to smuggle the drugs into the country by wrapping them in towels soaked in vinegar and chilli.

title.children: Four charged over alleged cocaine smuggling involving vinegar and chilli

image.altText: The Gallagher brothers hold each other's hand aloft while on stage

props.synopsis: Legendary Britpop group Oasis reunite in Wales for their first show together since 2009.

title.children: Oasis play first concert in 16 years

image.altText: worker smooths concrete at a slab pour with other workers in background.

props.synopsis: Australians have told the ABC that a lifetime of manual labour is making it difficult to work until pension age. An expert says there are some options for people who want, or need, to retire early.

title.children: Experts say there are other options if you can't work until pension age

image.altText: Mike Peters wears his police uniform pictured outside headquarters at a press conference

props.synopsis: Five people die in 24 hours in separate crashes on WA roads, as the state's road toll sits at its highest year-to-date level in a decade.

title.children: 'Wake-up call': Five people die in 24 hours on WA roads

image.altText: A man in a jersey looks down eating a hot dog.

props.synopsis: The 36-year-old Sydney man demolished 45-and-a-half hot dogs in just 10 minutes.

title.children: Sydney competitive eater places third in US hot dog eating contest

image.altText: A man in white tennis clothes punches the air in celebration.

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson defeats Italy's Luciano Darderi to make it to Wimbledon's last 16 for the first time.

title.children: Thompson makes career history with gutsy win at Wimbledon

image.altText: Image shows a close-up view of a man's hand holding an electric vehicle charger and inserting it in the charging point.

props.synopsis: Political unrest in the Middle East highlights Australia's fuel insecurity, but electric cars powered by renewable energy could change that.

title.children: EVs could be key to cutting Australia's dependence on oil imports

image.altText: Students dance in a circle at Dubbo College Senior Campus

props.synopsis: Dubbo College Senior Campus has the secret sauce to helping Indigenous students with a record number of year 12 graduates.

title.children: Fixing the racist history in Australian education

image.altText: A teenager stands in front of a bookshelf smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: In outback Queensland, where the arts can be seen as "niche", a writers' group is giving young creatives a safe space to flourish.

title.children: At 14, Jasmine's an international author thanks to outback writing group

image.altText: old woman in kooky glasses and a bright pink jacket.

props.synopsis: Our Timeless Threads combines nurse Maia Willow's passion for vintage and pre-loved fashion with her experience as an aged carer, and it's bringing joy to the elderly.

title.children: Senior fashionistas prove you're never too old to play dress-ups

image.altText: A white and orange plane with Air India Express lettering down the side

props.synopsis: Air India has been under intense scrutiny since one of its Boeing Dreamliners crashed in Ahmedabad in June, killing all but one of the 242 people onboard.

title.children: Air India budget carrier reprimanded over delayed repairs and falsified records

image.altText: Black and white photo of sheep and mounted drover in an open field.

props.synopsis: In 1882, drover Wallace Caldwell led the longest sheep drive in Australian history, but his story was almost lost to time.

title.children: Epic 3,500km trek, 11,000 sheep, and the young drover history forgot

image.altText: Jayden Seales raises his hand to celebrate as Australia batter Sam Konstas stands in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas chops on in the first over of the second innings and Usman Khawaja is trapped LBW after the West Indian tail scores valuable runs on day two in the second Test.

title.children: Nightwatchman Lyon makes it to stumps after openers out cheaply

image.altText: Two children with axes sit beside their dad.

props.synopsis: Furlyn Barrett was five years old when he was given his first axe. He's continuing the family tradition of woodchopping with his own children.

title.children: Furlyn's kids are chips off the old block and he couldn't be prouder

image.altText: CCC Commissioner John McKechnie speaks in a studio.

props.synopsis: After four decades of serving justice and fighting against corruption, John McKechnie has seen it all. He says some things never change.

title.children: In 40 years fighting for justice, John McKechnie learned some things never change
